title: Charlie Kirk murder: Messages, casings & rifle - How Tyler Robinson was caught
description: Tyler Robinson, 22, has been apprehended in Utah for the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Digital messages on Discord, unusual bullet casings, and campus surveillance footage led to Robinson's identification. The messages detailed plans to conceal a rifle and engrave bullets with threatening messages. Kirk, co-founder of Turning Point USA, was shot while speaking at Utah Valley University.

description: After eight years with Tesla, a senior engineer, Giorgio Balestrieri, has resigned, citing concerns over Elon Musk's leadership and its detrimental impact on Tesla's mission. Balestrieri praised his colleagues and the company's growth in energy storage but criticized Musk for allegedly lying to the public, manipulating discourse, and supporting climate change deniers.

title: Two people injured after United Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Japan, Kyodo says
Meet Diella: Albania appoints world’s first 'AI minister'; what's her role?
description: Albania has appointed Diella, an AI-powered minister, to combat corruption and enhance transparency in public spending. Overseeing government contracts, Diella aims to eliminate bias and manipulation, addressing Albania's long-standing struggle with corruption. This move aligns with Albania's EU accession goals, potentially strengthening credibility by ensuring corruption-free allocation of funds.

Russia-Ukraine war: Kremlin 'pauses' peace talks; Trump's truce move falters
description: Kremlin announced a pause in Russia-Ukraine peace talks. Donald Trump's efforts to mediate face challenges. Russia continues its offensive. Putin has ruled out meeting Zelenskyy. Recent attacks have escalated. Previous talks yielded prisoner swaps. Russia demands Donbas, while Ukraine seeks European peacekeepers. Poland rejects Trump's view on a Russian drone incursion, calling it deliberate.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan--on 20, 21, or 23 September?
description: The final solar eclipse of 2025, a partial one, is set to occur on September 21st, coinciding with the September equinox. This celestial event will be primarily visible in the Southern Hemisphere, offering spectacular views in New Zealand, parts of eastern Australia, and Antarctica. Observers in these regions will witness the Moon partially obscure the Sun, creating a crescent glow.

title: 'Might take to streets': Akhilesh's warning over vote chori; points to Nepal unrest
description: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has accused the Election Commission and the government of enabling "vote theft," warning of potential Nepal-like street protests in India if such practices continue unchecked. Speaking in Lucknow, Yadav cited past Uttar Pradesh polls, alleging caste-based appointments of officials and instances of election manipulation in Rampur, Mirapur, and Ayodhya.

description: At the box office, 'The Conjuring: Last Rites' outperformed both 'Baaghi 4' and 'The Bengal Files', earning Rs 67.87 crore in its first week. 'Baaghi 4' failed to reach Rs 50 crore, while 'The Bengal Files' earned Rs 11.25 crore in week 1.

description: Gracie Hunt, heiress to the Kansas City Chiefs' co-ownership, has amassed a $3 million fortune at just 23. Beyond her family's wealth, Gracie is forging her own path through philanthropy, pageantry, and sports management. Her journey from Miss Kansas USA to pursuing a Master's in Sport Management showcases her ambition and dedication to creating a personal legacy.

NEET PG Supreme Court hearing postponed: When is the next date?
description: The Supreme Court of India has postponed the hearing on the NEET PG 2025 transparency plea for two weeks, prolonging uncertainty for medical aspirants. Petitioners challenged NBEMS’s corrective notice that provided only question IDs instead of full questions and answer keys, arguing the format prevents proper verification. They seek complete disclosure, citing transparency practices in exams like JEE, CLAT, and AIIMS INI-CET.

Watch: Wheel falls off SpiceJet plane after take-off; pilots declare full emergency
description: A SpiceJet aircraft, en route to Mumbai from Kandla, experienced a tyre detachment during take-off. The incident prompted the pilots to declare a full emergency upon approach to Mumbai. Despite the loss of the tyre, the aircraft successfully landed, and all passengers disembarked without incident, as confirmed by a SpiceJet spokesperson.

title: 'Parallel BJP in Ambala': Anil Vij claims; his 'blessing' remark raises eyebrows
description: Anil Vij, a BJP MLA, has stirred controversy. He claims a parallel BJP operates in Ambala Cantonment. Vij suggests this faction has high-level support. He previously criticized Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini and state party chief Mohan Lal Badoli. Vij alleged collusion against him during the last election. The party issued Vij a show-cause notice for his remarks.

'Unusual president': Tharoor slams Trump over India policy - shares impact of US tariff
description: Shashi Tharoor criticized Donald Trump's unpredictable policies and tariffs, highlighting their damaging impact on India's economy, including job losses in key export sectors. He described Trump as disregarding diplomatic norms with unusual remarks and unfair sanctions on India for importing Russian oil, while China faces no such penalties.

title: Asia Cup: Why do Pakistan lose to India 'most of the times'? Ex-captain answers
description: Rashid Latif believes Pakistan's emotional approach in India matches leads to losses, contrasting with India's composed play. He praised India's balanced team, highlighting Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah as key strengths. Latif acknowledged Pakistan's pressure but notes India's lack of recent T20I experience as a potential disadvantage, while spotlighting Sahibzada Farhan as a potential game-changer.

Despite the lighthearted moment, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif cautioned against over-exuberance, citing India's consistent performance under pressure. Latif emphasized Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah as key players for India, while acknowledging Pakistan's potential spin advantage.

title: ‘If crackers have to be banned for pollution, why just in Delhi? do it nationwide,’ says SC
'Reality check': Lessons learnt from Op Sindoor; 'capability gaps' identified
description: Defence secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh stated that Operation Sindoor, a punitive strike on terror bases in Pakistan, served as a crucial assessment of India's defense capabilities. The operation exposed gaps in electronic warfare, counter-unmanned systems, and low-level radar technology. India is focusing on indigenous defense production and collaborating with DRDO to achieve self-reliance in defense.

description: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

Patrick Mahomes quiet after Charlie Kirk shooting; Randi Mahomes and Tavia Hunt speak out
description: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
description: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: Blake Lively ends friendship with Taylor Swift after singer's engagement
description: Reports indicate a rift between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively, with Lively seemingly accepting the end of their long-standing friendship. Sources suggest Lively is no longer preoccupied with Swift's life, particularly her engagement to Travis Kelce. Despite past attempts at reconciliation, Swift has remained unresponsive, and Lively is now focused on her own life.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up about her father’s hospital bills
description: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union spoke about managing money. She highlighted hospital expenses and insurance issues. Union mentioned her father's memory care costs. She also spoke about choosing roles based on financial needs. Dwyane Wade's net worth is $170 million. Gabrielle Union's net worth is $40 million. They share expenses equally. The couple has been together for over ten years.
